taskbody.context: At any time, you can perform a text search of all files on your workspace. For searching on Design Studio models resources you must know the exact syntax of source saved in models (DSL).

step.cmd:
On the menu bar, click
Search File
. Alternatively, on the toolbar, you can click
.
In the File search tab, do the following to refine your search criteria:

substep.cmd: In the Containing Text field, type the text that you are searching for. check the Case Sensitive or Regular expression box if required.
In the File name patterns section, enter the file extension(s) you want to search. Type: "*" for any type of file.
In the Scope section, select the location where you want the search restricted to.

step.cmd: Click Search to launch the search.
step.stepresult: The application displays the search results in the Properties view pane. The search results are organized by DS designers, similarly to the project.

step.cmd: Expand the nodes to drill down the search results.
To view a specific search result, double-click it.
step.stepresult: The associated model file is opened in the Editor area.
